channel.title: All-type extractor or coding help
channel.description:
Im sorry, but does anyone have an application that can extract any type of compressed file for linux ubuntu? because I don't know how to do rpm or rmp files or something, because I need to install some video drivers but they are in a format that I cannot extract at the moment.
Ohh and Mopar, and any others, please look at my post in the JAVA RE thread also. Thankyou

item.title: All-type extractor or coding help
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

rpm is the package format for redhat based distros, not debian based ones. There is a package called alien that can convert .rpm packages to debian ones. So all you have to do is:

sudo apt-get install alien
alien nameofrpm.rpm
dpkg install nameofrpm.deb

Those should be about right, probably not exactly.

Read full topic
